body:
what's wrong？
could you help me?
Use the right commit checkpoint if you try to use a released checkpoint. Your checkpoint and the code has size mismatch.

@erogol  Thank you!
Then could you tell me Where Could I got the right checkpoint?

so do you use the corresponding commit ?

```git checkout  db7f3d3 ```
if not, pls use that commit. If yes, that's a bug, but alas you are on your own to fix it until I find some time to go over it.

@erogol thank you for your reply!
I do clone db7f3d3 and got the same error

Hi @erogol, 
there is a misalignment between the git revision and the trained model.
I've created a fork with the fix. If you create a branch for db7f3d3 commit I can submit the MR.
Anyway you can take a look at my branch https://github.com/gnosly/TTS/tree/fix_185k_model

@erogol and @gnosly 
the db7f3d3 commit could run；
but the beginning of the generate wav lost:
“welcome"→”elcome“

Yep. it is a problem training the model, right @erogol? 
As workaround you could add an exclamation mark before the sentence you want synthesize and later remove from the output audio the first samples corresponding to the word “exclamation mark”

Fabrizio

> Il giorno 26 mar 2019, alle ore 04:30, peter05010402 <notifications@github.com> ha scritto:
> 
> @erogol and @gnosly
> the db7f3d3 commit could run；
> but the beginning of the generate wav lost:
> “welcome"→”elcome“
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
